Message.Title: US troops deployed here Ahead of Economic Collapse & Gun Confiscation
Message.Msg: The economic collapse, and ensuing civil unrest is coming – or so we’ve been told. Why else would Homeland Security buy up more than 2 billion bullets, purchase more than 2700 tanks and stock pile weaponry all while government white papers outline preparations for a martial law containment of society? Ahead of that breakdown of society, Washington and the powers that control it have deployed troops across America to train for domestic operation and acclimate the public to their presence. The friendlies, engaging in benign and innocuous activities, will foster trust among the people and let down their guard when things go dark later. It is classic psyops at work. In that context, we see an acceleration of National Guard and regular Army troops used at public sporting events, in crowd control at festivals and operating with police in law enforcement checkpoints, all in violation of Posse Comitatus. Small examples of this have been occurring regularly in Texas, with a National or State Guard presence at kite festivals, Texas Independence celebrations and other public events. Go to infowars and watch the video

Message.Title: Harry Boxer's Charts of the Day
Message.Msg: Harry has posted a Charts of the Day video on YHOO at TheTechTrader site noting: Yahoo! Inc. (YHOO) has been a stellar chart for six months now. It has gone from 14.08 in Sept to a high of 23.08, breaking out, running up to resistance, backing off, running up to the next resistance, backing off again, and finally breaking out and flagging. Message.Title: Yahoo Closing Message Boards
Message.Msg: Sports boards, specific interest boards, eccentric little boards, and anything not tied to a major Yahoo service (like Finance which is saving stock boards) are gone or going by March 1. This seems like a mistake and certainly harms the experience for long term users. No way to monetize? That seems to be the issue but it may be said of email as well.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Closing Message Boards

Message.Title: Now Do Away With Secure VPN As As Expense
Message.Msg: If you no longer telecommute, the company literally does not need to have secure VPN abilities, everyone at Yahoo can go to the office and log onto the compant network from a brick and mortar location. Secure VPN then becomes an expense that you no longer need to provide internally.

Message.Title: Is that true that Yahoo's stake in Yahoo Japan is now worth 9 billion?
Message.Msg: Wow! Are they ever going to be able to strike a deal?

Topic.Title: Is that true that Yahoo's stake in Yahoo Japan is now worth 9 billion?

Message.Msg: It's currently worth 35% of $25 billion which equals - $8.75. billion. I believe Yahoo Japan will move to $30 billion market cap making Yahoo's stake worth $10.5 billion. Add that to Yahoo's alibaba stake when Alibaba is $100 billion market cap and you have over $34 billion in cash. $40 stock price this year or next.

Message.Title: Why Yahoo is Worth $30
Message.Msg: Yahoo’s stake in Alibaba would be worth up to $11 billion after taxes, or roughly $10 per Yahoo share. Additionally, Yahoo’s 35% stake in Yahoo Japan is worth just under $8.5 billion - equivalent to about $5 per Yahoo Share after taxes. Yahoo also has about $6.5 billion in cash stashed away, which equals just under $6 per Yahoo share. If you add all of that together, you’re in the ballpark of $21. However, analysts suggest that Yahoo’s core business (advertising, search, mail, homepage, finance, etc...) is worth north of $10 billion, implying that Yahoo may be severely undervalued.

Topic.Title: Is that true that Yahoo's stake in Yahoo Japan is now worth 9 billion?

Message.Msg: Add Mayer growing revs and Yahoo is on it's way to $40 this year.

You might start out with about $34 billion if they sold everything, but wouldn't it end up at somewhere around maybe $22 billion? Not that $22 billion is anything to sneeze at.

Topic.Title: Why Yahoo is Worth $30

Message.Msg: It is repeatedly posted or published by many from MS, GS, Erick Jackson Forbes articles, Barclays, Needham, Stifel and others stating their estimated market value of Alibaba and what is worth for IPO. Obviously they reported with different numbers but truly they are basically "all in the ball park figure" because as you know West have limited access to Chinese companies balance sheet. So my take is that analysts/investment banks figures are taken from third parties like banks when Alibaba submitted their figures to get financing loan. YHOO itself is a reliable source of financial data of Alibaba due to their stakes. So please don't ask "where the numbers are coming from".

Topic.Title: Why Yahoo is Worth $30

Message.Msg: You're right Cold.... here ya go... it's from Eric Johnson's Street article dated Jan 30/13...(~~, "So the good news for Yahoo! shareholders is that their stake in YJ is worth $8.2 billion today vs. $5 billion a year ago. Net of taxes and fees, that YJ stake is worth $5.07 per Yahoo! share vs. $2.83 per share a year ago. So why would YJ want to do a deal now with Yahoo! for their 35% stake? Well, I'm sure if they had their druthers, they would have loved to do a deal with Scott Thompson at that discounted price. But even paying off Yahoo! at current prices, YJ would be crazy not to do it. Just today, YJ's stock was up 15% on good earnings and news of a planned stock buyback to retire 6% of their float. What would it do on news that YJ was going to retire another 35% of their shares -- the equivalent of 244x the daily volume of shares traded? It's worth it to YJ to do a deal with Yahoo!."

Message.Title: Hells bells

Message.Title: YHOO is playing their cards smartly with YJ & Softbank
Message.Msg: I really think MM is a very smart CEO. With CFO Goldman advice, MM is absolutely waiting for YJ management to approach YHOO to make a deal instead previous strategy from former YHOO CEO. As we know, why YHOO makes the first move if in fact the longer the wait to make a deal, advantage YHOO, stakes is growing in billion dollars. YJ growing robustly, then MM called the stakes "strategic" to YHOO, a ploy to entice YJ to make the deal move to buyback YHOO's 35% stakes. I also think that if YHOO decided to sell back their stakes to YJ, MM wants a guaranteed partnership contract to continue to receive the nice revenue from partnership. I think YJ/Softbank will eventually make the move to make a deal because it is obviously in their best interest (delaying it more, they pay YHOO more). I still think YHOO will deal their stakes with YJ, but YJ/softbank must make the first move. MM knows they got the leverage and YJ knows it too. I say if we have a deal, expect to tack in at least $5 minimum to YHOO share. Yes!!

Topic.Title: YHOO is playing their cards smartly with YJ & Softbank

Message.Msg: I strongly feel YHOO is a strong candidate for a buyout "after they monetized their Asian assets". Remember almost they own the number 1 ranking in many categories such as in news, finance, entertaiment, sports and the rest either in 2nd or 3rd position. Plus YHOO is the largest website in the world with over 600M users more or less. I think this is perfect fit for social network FB.
